## GAD-7 vs SCAN

The challenge of comparing psychological assessment tools, such as GAD-7 and SCAN, can be a daunting task with over 1800 potential items to compare amongst the two. But there's good news. Thanks to the innovative software, Harmony, psychologists and researchers no longer need to manually harmonise items in different questionnaires. When comparing the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) with Schedules for Clinical Assessment in Neuropsychiatry (SCAN), Harmony is an indispensable tool. Harmony uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI technology to objectively make the GAD-7 vs SCAN comparison. It provides an efficient, meticulous comparison of the seven items of GAD-7 and the vast array of over 1800 potential items in SCAN. The software even computes the percentage match amongst each item in GAD-7 vs SCAN, enabling researchers to make precise assessments and informed decisions. The web interface offers a user-friendly platform where researchers can simply upload their desired PDF tools for comparison. Utilising Harmony for the GAD-7 vs SCAN comparison means saving significant amounts of time and effort. More importantly, it provides a level of accuracy that leads to more reliable research outcomes. Harmony can even handle multi-lingual instruments, making it an essential tool for global studies. Eliminate the subjectivity and tedious manual labour involved in harmonisation with Harmony â€“ the brilliant solution for comparing GAD-7 vs SCAN.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SCAN

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SCAN into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SCAN into Harmony</a> - compare SCAN with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
